definition: to give in exchange for another : exchange
to convert (something, such as a payment) into another form
examples: The periodic payments may be commuted into a lump sum.

definition: to change (a penalty) to another less severe
examples: commute a death sentence to life in prison

definition: to pay in gross (see gross entry 3 sense 1)
to travel back and forth regularly (as between a suburb and a city)
examples: He commutes to work every day by car.

definition: to yield the same mathematical result regardless of order
an act or an instance of commuting
